Jason_Cassidy:
{{short description|American country music artist}} '''Jason Cassidy''' is an American country music artist. == Background == Jason Cassidy was born in [[New Caney, Texas]]. His first public performance was at the age of 13 when he sang “Jesus Is Here To Stay” at his church with his youth group singing as the lead. He began learning to play guitar at the age of 20, using books and YouTube videos.{{cite web|last1=Vernon|first1=Cheril|title=Jason Cassidy to kick off Hot Pepper music lineup Friday|url=http://www.palestineherald.com/news/local_news/jason-cassidy-to-kick-off-hot-pepper-music-lineup-friday/article_18c97827-ddb6-5527-92c5-56c295e0abc4.html|publisher=Palestine Herald-Press}} Cassidy began singing and playing in bars, and after being approached after a performance began singing performing as a singer with a country band, Husker Row.{{cite web|last1=Chandler|first1=Chip|title=Singer credits wife for career success|url=http://amarillo.com/get-out-music/2011-08-31/singer-credits-wife-career-success|publisher=Amarillo Globe-News}} == Music career == In 2009 Cassidy began writing material for his debut album and began working with producer Doug Deforest. The album was recorded at Lake Paradise Studios in Arkansas in August 2010 and released on November 2, 2010. He worked with radio promoter Rick Hogan to promote “Sounds Like An Angel To Me,”[http://www.chron.com/life/article/Jason-Cassidy-finds-his-Redemption-2200663.php "Jason Cassidy finds his Redemption"]. ''Chron'', By Andrew Dansby October 6, 2011 his first single, to Texas radio and it peaked on the Texas Music charts at #17.{{cite web|title=New Caney native makes debut at festival|url=http://www.yourhoustonnews.com/courier/living/new-caney-native-makes-debut-at-festival/article_5cb57b47-0ab3-58a5-ac46-8395bb9e0129.html|publisher=ASP Westward}} In April 2011 Cassidy signed to A-Blake Records who agreed to repackage and re-release ''My Redemption''.{{cite web|last1=Olson|first1=Kristi|title=New Music from Jason Cassidy: "My Redemption"|url=http://countrymusictattletale.com/2011/09/18/new-music-from-jason-cassidy-my-redemption/|publisher=Country Music Tattle Tale}} The new album contained an acoustic version of “Honky Tonk Heaven”{{cite web|last1=Dukes|first1=Billy|title=Jason Cassidy, ‘Honky Tonk Heaven’|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/jason-cassidy-honky-tonk-heaven-free-mp3/|publisher=Taste of Country}} and a newly recorded song “What Do You Have for a Heartache.”{{cite web|last1=Langford|first1=Camron|title=Country Singer Claims He's Been Defamed|url=http://www.courthousenews.com/2012/01/30/43436.htm|website=Courthouse News Service}} To coincide with the album release, Cassidy promoted “Honky Tonk Heaven” as a single, and it rose to the top of the charts in Texas; it was a #1 hit on TRRR,{{cite web|title=2012 Texas Gatorfest Artist Spotlight: Jason Cassidy|url=http://thebull.cbslocal.com/2012/09/11/2012-texas-gatorfest-artist-spotlight-jason-cassidy/|publisher=CBS Local}}{{cite web|title=Dave Darus Named President Of A-Blake Records|url=http://www.allaccess.com/net-news/archive/story/96747/dave-darus-named-president-of-a-blake-records|publisher=AllAccess.com}} and #2 on the Texas Music Chart which is published as part of Best In Texas magazine.{{cite web|title=Country singer Tracy Byrd to headline Lake Livingston concert|url=http://www.yourhoustonnews.com/cleveland/news/country-singer-tracy-byrd-to-headline-lake-livingston-concert/article_f0282850-9e11-577f-9fb6-f12732fd6604.html|publisher=Yourhoustonnews.com}} In 2013 Cassidy released his second album, ''Keep it Country''.[http://roughstock.com/news/2013/07/14711-album-review-jason-cassidy-keep-it-country/ "Album Review: Jason Cassidy – Keep It Country"]. ''Roughstock'', by Matt Bjorke on July 17, 2013[https://digitalrodeo.com/news/music-reviews-dos-divas-lorrie-morgan-and-pam-tillisten-nu-blukeep-it-country-jason-cassidy MUSIC REVIEWS: Dos Divas by Lorrie Morgan and Pam Tillis,Ten by Nu-Blu,Keep It Country by Jason Cassidy | digitalrodeo.com] During this period, Cassidy signed to Paradigm Nashville for exclusive booking and was featured in an article on rising country stars in Billboard Country Update.{{cite web|title=2012 CMA Music Fest Info And Schedule|url=http://www.nashville.com/music/2012/06/2012-cma-music-fest-info-and-schedule/|publisher=Nashville.com}} The release of “What If” followed, and was accompanied by a music video directed by Ryan Smith and Potsy Poncirolli of Nashville.{{cite web|last1=Hackett|first1=Vernell|title=Jason Cassidy’s New Video Asks ‘What If?’|url=http://theboot.com/jason-cassidy-what-if-video/|publisher=The Boot}} The video was aired on [[CMT.com]], GAC’s “Out of The Box,” and on CMT Pure where it reached the #1 spot on March 30, 2012 on the network’s 12-Pack Countdown.{{cite web|title=Jason Cassidy headlines at Big Texas-Spring on April 5|url=http://www.yourhoustonnews.com/greater_houston/entertainment/jason-cassidy-headlines-at-big-texas-spring-on-april/article_89f1879e-7d08-11e1-8b25-0019bb2963f4.html|publisher=Yourhoustonnews.com}} It remained in the Top 10 for nearly five months.{{cite web|last1=Dauphin|first1=Chuck|title=Spotlight: Jason Cassidy Connects With 'What If'|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-615/498728/spotlight-jason-cassidy-connects-with-what-if|publisher=Billboard.com}} In 2015, Cassidy release the album ''717'', a mix of traditional and modern country songs.[http://thedailycountry.com/6/post/2015/08/album-review-jason-cassidy-717.html "Album Review: Jason Cassidy '717'"]. ''Daily Country'', 08/14/2015[http://lonestar92.com/jason-cassidy-717-out-now/ "Jason Cassidy ‘717’ Out Now"].
